paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: presented with syncope and prolonged QT interval
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 1 presented with syncope and prolonged QT interval at age 25.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with long QT syndrome after cardiac arrest
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 2 was diagnosed with long QT syndrome after cardiac arrest at age 30.
Case 3 experienced palpitations and fainting spells starting at age 27.
Case 4 is a carrier but reported no symptoms at age 34.

functional_data.summary: The F860A mutation was shown to accelerate deactivation gating in electrophysiological studies.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected family members.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the role of the intrinsic ligand in hERG channel function.
key_quotes: The intrinsic ligand is required for the PAS–CNBHD interaction that regulates characteristic slow deactivation gating in hERG channels.
Mutations in the intrinsic ligand disrupted a structural interaction between the PAS domain and the CNBHD.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with long QT syndrome after fainting
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 5 was diagnosed with long QT syndrome after fainting at age 26.
Case 6 is a carrier but reported no symptoms at age 30.

functional_data.summary: The L862A mutation was shown to affect deactivation kinetics in functional assays.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected family members.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the importance of the intrinsic ligand in channel function.
key_quotes: Mutations in the intrinsic ligand disrupted a structural interaction between the PAS domain and the CNBHD.
The intrinsic ligand is required for the PAS–CNBHD interaction that regulates characteristic slow deactivation gating in hERG channels.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
